alert.note: Alert for Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 10:40PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN ROOSEVELT COUNTY THROUGH 1115 PM MDT... At 1040 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pep, or 25 miles south of Portales, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Portales, Dora, Causey, Milnesand, Lingo, Arch, Pep and Rogers. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
